We have enough to worry about in the world right now without looking too far into the future -- or, for that matter, fretting about something as relatively unimportant as college football. But indulge me for a moment and consider this scenario:

articles.title: Louisville's Scott Satterfield fears NCAA rules change could lead to 'wild, wild west' - Courier Journal
articles.description: The NCAA's new posture on athlete compensation could create a new set of problems for college coaches.
articles.content:
Scott Satterfield is scared. He fears college football is on a collision course with dollar-driven free agency; that removing barriers to athlete compensation could embolden big-money boosters to start poaching his best players for rival schools.
